alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 11:44AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by backwater from recent ice jams and snowmelt * WHERE...Lower Yukon River and associated tributaries from Grayling downstream to the Yukon Delta as far as Nunam Iqua and Kotlik. * WHEN...Until 415 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Backwater from recent ice jams between Russian Mission and Mountain Village as well as snow melt moving down from the Upper Yukon has led to extensive overbank flooding of lowlands on the Lower Yukon River from Grayling down to Mountain Village, as well as down the Innoko River at Shageluk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1136 AM AKDT, Recent observations from River Watch flights as well as satellite imagery confirm large areas of overbank flooding in this region, with water backing up all small tributaries including the Andreafsky River. As the breakup front pushes downstream towards the Middle and South Mouth of the Yukon River, high water is expected to impact the communities of Kotlik and Nunam Iqua in the coming days. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
